text.text: The Company has conducted a 16,000m drill program at Graal
The program targeted the Bouguer Anomaly. The company is seeking to identify significant amounts of nickel-copper-sulphide mineralization at the base of the magmatic chamber.
Early-stage drill results have been excellent
Initial drilling intersected massive sulphides proven with detailed assays showing 1.07% NiEq and 2.26% CuEq over 28.9m mostly at shallow depths of only 50 to 100m.
Nickel and Copper equivalents based on Nickel US$18,134.00/tonne, Copper US$8,560.55/tonne and Cobalt $28,550.00/tonne as of March 13, 2024.
